name: natebjones
headline: On Valentineâ€™s Day, OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger posted three paragraphs on his personal blog announcing he was joining OpenAI.
content: On Valentineâ€™s Day, OpenClaw creator Peter Steinberger posted three paragraphs on his personal blog announcing he was joining OpenAI. It was not about the money. Zuckerberg and Altman both came calling. Zuckerberg reached out via WhatsApp, and they reportedly spent 10 minutes arguing about whether Claude or GPT was the better coding model. Steinberger admitted he got more hands-on engagement from Zuckerberg than from Altman. He chose OpenAI anyway. When Lex Fridman asked if this was the hardest decision he'd ever faced: "Nah." This is a guy who already did a nine-figure exit. Spent three years after doing therapy and ayahuasca and what he called "a period of deep searching." Came back to coding because AI pulled him back. Churned through 43 projects before landing on number 44. His posture in the negotiation was "I don't do this for the money. I don't give a fu#$." If you have nothing to lose or to prove, you're willing to give an AI agent access to systems because he could afford to watch it break. Now that audacity lives inside OpenAI. What OpenAI has not had is a consumer-facing agent product that people actually use in daily life to manage real tasks on email, calendars, messaging, file management across their own devices. And Steinberger says he wants to build precisely that at OpenAI: an agent his mother could use. The question is whether the person who could afford not to care about consequences can build something safe enough for millions of people who can't afford the same mistakes. Curious about your take.

name: stephaniehillsphd
headline: The Painful Reality You wake up dreading Monday. You sit in meetings, watching the clock, counting the hours until Friday.
content: The Painful Reality You wake up dreading Monday. You sit in meetings, watching the clock, counting the hours until Friday. The paycheck is good, the work is fine, but deep down, you knowâ€” this isnâ€™t it . You tell yourself itâ€™s too late to switch careers. That stability is more important. That you should be grateful. But hereâ€™s the hard truth: staying in a job you donâ€™t love is the biggest risk of allâ€”because one day, youâ€™ll run out of time. My Leadership Journey From researcher to software engineer to engineering manager to program manager to technology executive to coach and consultant... I have worked in academia, as a defense contractor in the Pentagon, and in companies from small 100+ employees to 2 Fortune 500 companies and eventually launched my own business. What has held true throughout is that my passion is helping others, mentoring, teachingâ€¦To see an engineer or executive or team grow, find their passion, and succeed in what they love is what drives me. When I mentor or coach someone, the first thing I ask is â€œWhat is your Passion?â€? Why Your Career Should Align with Your Passion Hereâ€™s why doing work you love isnâ€™t just a luxuryâ€”itâ€™s a necessity: ğŸ”¹ Youâ€™ll perform better â€“ When you love what you do, you naturally excel at it. ğŸ”¹ Youâ€™ll be more fulfilled â€“ No more Sunday night anxiety or counting down to retirement. ğŸ”¹ Youâ€™ll make a bigger impact â€“ Passion fuels persistence, and persistence drives success. ğŸ”¹ You wonâ€™t regret the years â€“ Time is the one thing you never get back. ğŸš€ Tools & Surveys to Discover Your Passion & Ideal Career Path Instead of just saying "Follow your passion," use science-backed tools to uncover what actually excites and energizes you . ğŸ”¥ 1 Ikigai Framework: The Japanese Secret to Finding Purpose Instead of thinking "What do I love?" â€”use the Ikigai framework to find the intersection of â“ What You Love (Passion) â“ What Youâ€™re Good At (Talent) â“ What the World Needs (Impact) â“ What You Can Be Paid For (Sustainability) ğŸ‘‰ Try This: Draw 4 overlapping circles for these categories and write in answers for each. Your Ikigai is the sweet spot in the middle. ğŸ“– Book: Ikigai: The Japanese Secret to a Long and Happy Life â€“ HÃ©ctor GarcÃ­a & Francesc Miralles ğŸ”¥ 2 The "Sparketype" Assessment: What Truly Energizes You? The Sparketype Assessment (by Jonathan Fields) helps you discover the type of work that makes you come alive. ğŸ”¹ Primary Sparketype: Your core driver (e.g., The Scientist, The Advisor, The Maker) ğŸ”¹ Shadow Sparketype: A secondary work style that complements your primary. ğŸ‘‰ Take the Free Test Here: https://www.sparketype.com/ ğŸ“– Book: Sparked: Discover Your Unique Imprint for Work That Makes You Come Alive â€“ Jonathan Fields ğŸ”¥ 3 The VIA Character Strengths Test: Your Superpower at Work This scientifically validated test from positive psychology helps you find your top strengthsâ€”so you can align your work with what makes you feel naturally confident and fulfilled . ğŸ‘‰ Take the Free Test Here: https://www.viacharacter.org/ ğŸ“– Book: The Power of Character Strengths: Appreciate and Ignite Your Positive Personality â€“ Ryan Niemiec & Robert McGrath ğŸ”¥ 4 The â€œRegret Minimization Frameworkâ€ â€“ Jeff Bezos' Decision-Making Hack Instead of stressing about â€œWhatâ€™s the perfect career?â€ ask yourself: ğŸ“Œ "At 80 years old, will I regret NOT doing this?" If the answer is yes , itâ€™s time to act. ğŸ“– Book: Invent & Wander: The Collected Writings of Jeff Bezos ğŸ”¥ 5 Take Action: Whatâ€™s Your Passion Score? Ask yourself these three innovation-driven questions : â“ When do I feel fully energized and in flow at work? â“ If I had financial security , what would I spend my time doing? â“Whatâ€™s something I can spend hours learning about and never get bored? Whatâ€™s Next? Now that you truly understand your passion take these next steps! âœ… Explore the Market â€“ How can you monetize your strengths? What careers or business opportunities align with them? âœ… Start Small, Test the Waters â€“ Donâ€™t quit todayâ€”start learning, networking, or even side hustling first. âœ… Take the Leap â€“ When youâ€™ve built a foundation, go all in. Your future self will thank you. Whether it is in another role at your current company, working for another company, or starting your own business, you should wake up every day excited for the day ahead! If you feel like youâ€™re meant for more , you probably are. Donâ€™t settle. You have one lifeâ€”make it count. ğŸ’¬ Whatâ€™s stopping you from pursuing a career you love? Drop your thoughts below. #CareerChange #DoWhatYouLove #CareerGrowth #WorkWithPurpose #PassionAndSuccess

name: patrick-szymkowiak
headline: The migration to the cloud is still difficult if you have a low internet access or no internet access. In this case you have to do on premise architecture.
content: The migration to the cloud is still difficult if you have a low internet access or no internet access. In this case you have to do on premise architecture. Microsoft has the good idea to unify the public cloud and the on premise world with azure stack. In this new feature of Microsoft we could create a small azure on premise. the benefit is to create the same application for any region, any country public or on premise. We can also migrate legacy applications to a new azure architecture and stay on premise. As a result it will be easier to sell solutions for on premise or public cloud on the azure market place. Here the list of azure stack features: azure stack white paper azure stack datasheet azure stack website

name: ybernstein
headline: Ownership is a state of mind. It is a fire in your belly.
content: Ownership is a state of mind. It is a fire in your belly. Ownership drives a laser focus on delivering valuable outcomes for the business. Autonomy and accountability both factor into this. Set lofty goals, work hard to come up with an optimised plan, demand the autonomy and resources needed to achieve those goals. Advocacy to leadership is a key part of having ownership. Things that individuals and teams with a true sense of ownership have: A sense of urgency. All your work counts for nothing until it is delivering value. Therefore, a true sense of ownership also drives a sense of urgency. Teams with a sense of ownership canâ€™t wait to start delivering value to their users and their business. This impatience should drive a ruthless desire for efficiency within the team, a bias towards delivery, and a hunger for learning. However, a sense of urgency does not and should not mean burning oneself out, nor does it mean taking damaging shortcuts. High expectations of each other. Your teamâ€™s success is your success, and your team cannot succeed unless all functions are doing their jobs well. Therefore having low expectations of others is equivalent to having low expectations of yourself. Teams with a sense of ownership generate â€œGoodâ€ pressure. Bad pressure comes from outside the team. Bad pressure causes stress and fatigue. Bad pressure is a crushing force and makes a team smaller . Good pressure comes from inside a team, and makes it bigger . It creates energy and motivation, a sense of agency. Think of a balloon, or a tyre. Pressure from within is what allows them to take shape and perform their job. Without pressure they are flaccid and useless. A sense of ownership generates good pressure. Owners escalate frequently. Teams that are driven to deliver value do not tolerate obstacles that stand in the way of doing so. Those that they can remove themselves, they remove themselves. Other obstacles are escalated to their leaders for swift resolution. Obstacles come in many forms: under-resourcing, lack of clarity, missing context, inability to reach a decision, and more. Teams that own see it as their duty to bringing those obstacles to the attention of those who can remove them. They understand that otherwise they are not doing their jobs. Justified conviction in their course of action. A team with a sense of ownership knows the best plan to achieve valuable outcomes in their domain. They know this because they are the world experts in their area of the product, and have the data to justify their beliefs and convictions. Because of this, they are not diverted easily. They are open to feedback and questions from company leaders, but more often than not they defend their position because they know more and have thought more about their domain that their leaders have.

name: marinawu
headline: Earlier this week I said yes to a dinner where I had zero clue who'd be on the guest list ğŸ˜…
content: Earlier this week I said yes to a dinner where I had zero clue who'd be on the guest list ğŸ˜… As someone who gets a little nervous about social events, walking into a room of potential strangers isn't exactly a hell yeah every time. But the organiser Nathaniel Diong ğŸš€ was someone I'd seen in the LinkedIn-verse for years but we'd just never had the chance to actually meet so may as well go. Turns out it was the best kind of surprise. A mix of old friends and new ones, founders, VCs, social entrepreneurs all around the same table What made it special wasn't just who was there, it was how Nathaniel ran it. The "We're Not Really Strangers" conversation prompts that completely changed the energy. A few of us got to shoutout our parents and share a bit about them (genuinely wholesome ğŸ¥¹), and we even got an impromptu Bob Dylan performance Big networking events have their place. But curated, intimate dinners with thoughtful conversation? That's where you skip the surface level stuff and get to the real person behind the LinkedIn profile Shoutout Nathaniel Diong ğŸš€ for putting this together and to everyone around the table for making it such a great night ğŸ¤ When's the last time saying "yes" to something unexpected paid off for you? ğŸ‘€

name: stephaniehillsphd
headline: We all have dreams, goals, and aspirationsâ€”but how often do we delay taking action? Years ago, I had big ambitions to start my own business to help others in their career. I found myself stuck in a cycle of overthinking.
content: We all have dreams, goals, and aspirationsâ€”but how often do we delay taking action? Years ago, I had big ambitions to start my own business to help others in their career. I found myself stuck in a cycle of overthinking. I kept telling myself, â€œIâ€™ll start when Iâ€™m ready.â€ But ready never came. Instead, weeks turned into months, and months into years. Opportunities slipped awayâ€”not because I lacked ability, but because I hesitated. Sound familiar? Maybe youâ€™ve been meaning to launch that business, apply for that leadership role, or start building your personal brand. But something keeps holding you backâ€”the fear of failure, the endless search for the â€œperfectâ€ time, or the voice in your head whispering, â€œWhat if Iâ€™m not good enough?â€ The real enemy? Procrastination. It disguises itself as preparation and perfectionism , but in reality, itâ€™s just a thief stealing your future. It keeps you comfortable but costs you progress. It convinces you that tomorrow is betterâ€”but tomorrow never comes. ğŸ”¥ Hereâ€™s the truth: Success doesnâ€™t wait for you to be ready. The most successful people take action before they feel prepared. They move despite the fear. They build momentum, one imperfect step at a time. If you want to change your life, start today. Not tomorrow. Not someday. Now. Take one step forward, no matter how small. Send that email. Make that call. Start that project. ğŸš¨ 3 Easy Ways to Beat Procrastination & Take Back Control Every Day âœ… The 5-Minute Rule â€“ If a task feels overwhelming, commit to doing it for just 5 minutes. Action kills anxiety. Once you start, the resistance fades, and youâ€™ll feel the relief of progress instead of the guilt of delay . âœ… Future Pain vs. Present Pain â€“ Ask yourself: How will I feel if I donâ€™t do this? Imagine the regret, stress, and frustration of staying stuck. Now flip itâ€”picture the confidence, momentum, and freedom youâ€™ll feel when itâ€™s done. Choose progress over regret. âœ… Make It Public â€“ Tell someone your goal. Accountability forces action. When you follow through, you gain pride and self-trust instead of the shame of broken promises to yourself . ğŸ”¥ Every time you delay, you make the pain of inaction stronger. But every time you act, you widen the gap between your old, stuck self and your new, unstoppable self . ğŸ”¥ Procrastination is the assassination of your destination. Action ends anxietyâ€”move now, win later. ğŸ”¥ ğŸ’¡ What are your procrastination hacks? â¬‡ï¸

name: samueltyang
headline: Excited to share some big news: I've joined Diagrid as President!
content: Excited to share some big news: I've joined Diagrid as President! name: robertroskam
headline: Many of us software engineers got into this field because we preferred the rigid predictability of machines.
content: Many of us software engineers got into this field because we preferred the rigid predictability of machines. We prefer the dialog with the machines via code. But your code involves people at every stage. A person wrote the ticket. A person will review your pull request. A person will use it. A person will maintain it after you have moved on. Even the code you write alone on a side project is a conversation with your future self. You can try to fight this reality. Treat meetings as a waste of time. Bristle at code reviews you get and rubber stamp every one you give. Treat user complaints as largely edge cases. Some engineers do this their entire career. The code is not the work. It is part of it, but not all of it. The work is always with other people, though. Always.

name: abidalee
headline: â€˜An empty vessel makes the loudest soundâ€™ -- Plato Knowledgeable people are often humble and consider themselves the least knowledgeable among others. Such people have the benefit of learning the most from others.
content: â€˜An empty vessel makes the loudest soundâ€™ -- Plato Knowledgeable people are often humble and consider themselves the least knowledgeable among others. Such people have the benefit of learning the most from others. To the contrary, people who believe they know it all, lose a greater opportunity to learn from others. It is necessary to â€˜listenâ€™ more than â€˜talkâ€™. We can never learn enough as the learning continues a life time. Unfortunately, we live in a competitive world and the life around us is constantly evolving. Several new things are invented every day. In order to play along the competition, it is necessary to stay abreast of the new trends and emerging technologies. We should â€˜stay hungry and foolishâ€™ as it helps in acquiring the new knowledge. â€˜Constantly re-inventing selfâ€™ means we should learn new things but also â€˜unlearnâ€™ the things which are obsolete, as it will create room for new learning. Sometimes past knowledge is useful, while other times, it can hinder the acquisition of the new knowledge. We should, therefore, â€˜empty our minds, be formless, shapeless, like water, water can flow, water can crashâ€¦â€™ , and, â€˜keep on moving as the running water never goes stale.â€™ #ParwaazTheFlight #LightACandle #FightTheDarkness Web: http://parwaaztheflight.org Facebook: www.facebook.com/ParwaazTheFlight Twitter: https://twitter.com/ParwazTheFlight YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCgAstmkdXHxq7i40qVRYPsw Let's 'light a candle', the candle of 'kindness', the candle of 'hope', the candle of 'love and affection', and the candle of 'knowledge and wisdom', to 'fight the darkness', the darkness 'within and around.'

name: caseybhawkins
headline: ğŸ”¥ TOP 5 HUBSPOT UPDATES FROM FEBRUARY 17, 2026 ğŸ”¥
content: ğŸ”¥ TOP 5 HUBSPOT UPDATES FROM FEBRUARY 17, 2026 ğŸ”¥ We're back! A few days off from the show and HubSpot dropped twenty-four updates on us. Chris had some technical difficulties getting the stream going this morning, George and I held it down for about 30 seconds, and then we were off to the races. Twenty-four updates is a LOT to cover, and honestly? Picking just five was tough. There are some heavy hitters in this batch. Here's what made the cut, but check out the blog for the full breakdown on all twenty-four. Here's what dropped: âš™ï¸ Add Line Items to Deals via Workflow Actions (Request Beta) This one is huge. You can now select a product from your library, set a quantity, and automatically attach line items to deals when a workflow fires. No more manual deal setup or custom-coded actions. Chris called out that this replaces a ton of custom code people have been maintaining, and he's right. ğŸ‘‰ Request beta: https://hubs.li/Q043nyLv0 ğŸ¯ Conditional Scoring with "and" for Lead Scores AND Health Scores (Live) Finally. Scoring rules now support compound "and" criteria, so you can award points only when multiple conditions are met. I've been waiting for this one. One caveat: the "and" rules are within a single action type right now, so cross-object conditions (like form submission + job title) still need a list or workflow. But this is a major step. ğŸ‘‰ Learn more: https://hubs.li/Q043nwPb0 ğŸ“‹ Enhanced Multi-Step Form Logic (Beta) New hide and show step-level actions let you dynamically control which steps visitors see based on their responses. Skip to Step is deprecated, and if all remaining steps get hidden, the Submit button surfaces automatically. George's reaction: "Getting pretty powerful over there with the forms." ğŸ‘‰ Join beta: https://hubs.li/Q043nry20 ğŸ”„ Workflow CRM Property Data Restore (Beta, Enterprise) If a workflow accidentally updates thousands of records with the wrong value, you can now undo those changes within fourteen days. Built on HubSpot's unified backup system. This is the safety net ops teams have needed. ğŸ‘‰ Join beta: https://hubs.li/Q043nyTW0 ğŸ” Granular Filter Insights in Segments (Beta) You can now see exactly how each filter shapes your segment as you build it, in real time. Zero-match filters get flagged. No more saving, checking, tweaking, saving again. ğŸ‘‰ Join beta: https://hubs.li/Q043nw650 The theme today? Confidence. Scoring with precision, building segments with transparency, restoring data after mistakes, and automating deal setup without manual cleanup. The tools are getting smarter AND safer. Which update are you testing first? Catch Chris Carolan, George B. Thomas, and me live weekdays at 8:30am ET on LinkedIn, or on Apple or Spotify. #HubSpot #HubSpotUpdates #HubSpotCRM #Automation #CRM #WakeUpCustomerPlatform

name: stephaniehillsphd
headline: I had COVID. And it hit hard.
content: I had COVID. And it hit hard. Not just physicallyâ€”but mentally and emotionally. Six weeks of being down and out. And even when I â€œrecovered,â€ I didnâ€™t feel like myself. Covid fatigue lingered. Some days I felt great. Other days, just walking around felt like a win. But in the stillness, something powerful happenedâ€¦ ğŸ¤” I had an epiphany. I wasn't going to let COVID win, yet I didnâ€™t want to just get back to how things were. Because how things were wasnâ€™t really working. My life before was full. Busy. â€œSuccessful.â€ But it was all about doing . Checking boxes. Managing everyone elseâ€™s needs. But never really putting myself first, my needs, my MUSTS. Always productiveâ€”but rarely present. And I realized: I had been leaving myself out of my own life. ğŸ˜± â“Is this you? ğŸš« Youâ€™re always â€œon.â€ ğŸš« You show up for everyoneâ€”but barely for yourself. ğŸš« Your to-do list runs your day. ğŸš« You move fast, but never feel fulfilled. ğŸš« You feel guilty if you pause. ğŸš« But exhausted if you donâ€™t. ğŸš« You keep thinking youâ€™ll get to youâ€¦ later. ğŸš« But later never comes. Because youâ€™ve been wired to serve, succeed, and survive. Not to slow down , heal , or be . And hereâ€™s the problem... The world praises overachievers. ğŸš« We applaud people who grind through fatigue. ğŸš« We normalize skipping sleep, numbing emotions, and â€œpowering through.â€ But no one talks about how that lifestyle eats away at your health, your joy, and your identityâ€”until something forces you to stop. Until your body says no more. Until your mind canâ€™t focus. Until your soul feels distant. Weâ€™ve been conditioned to hustle through the warning signs. To believe rest is weak. To wear exhaustion like a badge of honor. ğŸ’ª What I decided instead? That moment when I realized I had been leaving myself out of my own life changed me. I decided I wasnâ€™t going back to the old version of my life. ğŸ‰ I wanted to live with intent. ğŸ‰ To be present â€”for myself, for my sons, and for the life I still had ahead. So I rebuilt my days from a new foundation. Not around urgency. But around alignment . ğŸ”º The Wellness Triangle: My New Non-Negotiable I returned to the basics, the things that really matter: ğŸ§  Mind ğŸ‹ï¸â™€ï¸ Body ğŸŒ± Soul âœ… Every day, I nourish all three: Mental Priming to clear my thoughts and set my intention Pilates + Cardio to strengthen and energize my body Hydration â€”water, water, water Eating Healthy â€”whole foods, no processed oils, plant-based proteins, smaller meals Presence â€”truly showing up with the people I love Gratitude, Faith, and Joy â€”because my soul needs nourishment too Then I zoomed out even further... ğŸŒ± The 7 Elements of a Fulfilled Life Once I rebuilt my foundation around the Wellness Triangle â€”Mind, Body, and Soulâ€”I realized there was more to balance than just personal health. Living with intention means being present and on purpose in every part of life that matters. â“I thought, what are the elements of my life that really matter? Here are the 7 core elements where you can show up, engage, and experience fulfillment . These are the areas where we invest our time, energy, and heart. âœ… And while you might not give all of them equal time every day, you can make space for them all consistently. 1. Relationships / Community ğŸ¤ Quality time, emotional presence, & love. This is where connection lives. The people we care about. The ones we show up forâ€”and who show up for us. 2. Work / Career / Mission ğŸ’¼ Meaningful impact that aligns with your purpose. We all want to build something that matters. Fulfillment comes when your work reflects your values and your gifts. 3. Health & Energy ğŸ’ª Movement, nourishment & feeling your best. This is the fuel that powers everything. Itâ€™s not about perfectionâ€”itâ€™s about feeling strong, energized, and well. 4. Faith / Spirituality ğŸ™ Trust, gratitude & connection. This is your inner compass. Whether itâ€™s through faith, prayer, or quiet reflectionâ€”itâ€™s what keeps you grounded in something deeper. 5. Growth & Learning ğŸ“˜ Curiosity, growth & becoming your best. When we grow, we feel alive. Stretching your mind and expanding your skills keeps life exciting and evolving. 6. Giving ğŸŒ Helping others, paying it forward with heart. Whether itâ€™s mentoring, supporting, or simply showing upâ€”giving is how we live beyond ourselves. 7. Fun & Adventure ğŸ‰ Laughter, travel & joy. Play matters. So does exploration. Make space for what makes you feel alive. â†’ When these 7 elements are honoredâ€”not perfectly, but intentionallyâ€”you begin to feel aligned. Not pulled in every direction. Not surviving, but thriving . ğŸ”¥ Final Thoughts âœ¨ Itâ€™s not about balance. Itâ€™s about making space for what truly matters.The life you want isnâ€™t found in the hustleâ€”itâ€™s built in the balance. 1ï¸âƒ£ Be WELL . Honor your mind. Care for your body. Feed your soul. â¤ï¸ğŸ©¹ 2ï¸âƒ£ FULFULL all the areas of your life, Relationships/Community, Work/Career/Mission, Giving, Fun & Adventure, Growth & Learning, Health & Energy, Faith & Spirituality ğŸ‰ This changed my life. This is the foundation of everything. Letâ€™s stop just doing. And start living with intention. â‰ï¸ Are you living a WELL and FULFILLED life? ğŸš€ I challenge you to make just one change a week and watch your joy skyrocket! â™» Repost to encourage your network to inspire others. â• Follow me ( Stephanie Hills, Ph.D. ) for more like this. #freedomseekers #careerfreedom #leadershipdevelopment #balancedlife #fulfilledlife #worklifebalance #dreamlife

name: stephaniehillsphd
headline: When I was in my tech exec role, I looked successful on paper. Big title.
content: When I was in my tech exec role, I looked successful on paper. Big title. Big team. Global projects. But deep down? I felt boxed in. Meetings that didnâ€™t matter. Metrics that didnâ€™t move me. And a constant tug in my chest that whispered, â€œThis isnâ€™t it.â€ I kept asking myself, â€œWhatâ€™s the next role?â€ â€œWhat promotion should I chase?â€ But every step up just felt like more pressureâ€”never more purpose. Until I stopped chasing the next titleâ€¦ And started designing the life I actually wanted. You donâ€™t start reevaluating their career because you have a 10-step plan. You do it because you're done . ğŸ˜± Done feeling stuck. ğŸ˜± Done being overlooked or underpaid. ğŸ˜± Done living on someone elseâ€™s schedule. ğŸ˜± Done wondering, â€œIs this really it?â€ You donâ€™t always know what they want nextâ€” You just know: Something has to change. So you start searchingâ€¦ â¡ï¸ You scroll LinkedIn. â¡ï¸ You update your resume. â¡ï¸ You ask ChatGPT: â€œWhatâ€™s the best career to go into in 2025?â€ And the internet answers: â—ï¸Go into tech. â—ï¸Try product management. â—ï¸Start consulting. â—ï¸Become a coach. â—ï¸Get certified. â—ï¸Pivot to AI. Whateverâ€™s trending this week. So you pick something. âœ” Apply for roles. âœ” Maybe even get promoted. âœ” Land the job. But a few months in? That old feeling creeps back in. ğŸ˜± Still stuck. ğŸ˜± Still unfulfilled. ğŸ˜± Still not living the life you imagined. You changed the job... But not the approach. Hereâ€™s why that happens: Because you started with the wrong question. You asked: â€œWhat role will get me ahead?â€ Instead of: â€œWhat kind of life do I wantâ€”and what path gets me there?â€ One leads to the next title. The other leads to long-term freedom, growth, and purpose. Because the right next move? Isnâ€™t always a new job. Itâ€™s not always a promotion. And itâ€™s definitely not whatever the algorithm is pushing. ğŸ”¥ Itâ€™s alignment. ğŸ”¥ Between who you are and how you show up in your work. Your career isnâ€™t just a ladder. Itâ€™s a vehicle . A way to create the life you want to live. But you have to know what that life looks like first. So instead of asking: â€œWhat should I do next?â€ Start asking: â‰ï¸ How do I want to wake up every day? â‰ï¸ What kind of work energizes me? â‰ï¸ What kind of problems do I love solving? â‰ï¸ What kind of people do I want to work with? â‰ï¸ What would my career look like if it bent around my lifeâ€”not the other way around? Because once you answer thatâ€¦ âš¡ï¸ The clarity shows up. âš¡ï¸ The right roles become obvious. âš¡ï¸ The growth becomes sustainable. âš¡ï¸ And the fulfillment becomes real. Not because you followed the trendâ€” But because you followed your truth. So whatâ€™s it going to be? Another title that looks good on paper but leaves you drained? Or a path that gives you the IMPACT, FREEDOM, MEANING youâ€™ve been craving? ğŸ’ª Once you choose you , you get to choose everything else. Why did I write this? Iâ€™ve been hearing from so many professionals latelyâ€” People who are brilliant, capable, experiencedâ€” But stuck in decision loops. Debating between titles. Overthinking every option. Trying to guess what will finally feel right. But clarity doesnâ€™t come from a job title. It comes from you . So I wrote this to shift the conversation. Back to what actually matters. So you stop building your career from pressure, comparison, or â€œshouldsâ€â€¦ And start creating from alignment, purpose, and real inner clarity. Because thatâ€™s where the momentum lives. Thatâ€™s where the MAGIC happens. ğŸ’« Need a place to start? âœ… Try this: â€œRemind Me Who I Amâ€ Career Prompt (ChatGPT) â€œAct as a motivational coach who helps people get clarityâ€”not by telling me what to do, but by helping me remember who I am. Guide me through a powerful reflection to reconnect with: ğŸ”· What I actually want from life ğŸ”· What kind of work lights me up ğŸ”· The kind of days I want to live ğŸ”· What Iâ€™ve been afraid to admit I want ğŸ”· What kind of role Iâ€™d pursue if I stopped chasing approval and started trusting myself Ask me deep questions, push past surface answers, and reflect back what you see in meâ€”and whatâ€™s possible if I stop playing small.â€ ğŸš€ Your next move isnâ€™t in a job board. Itâ€™s in YOU. Letâ€™s start there. â™» Repost to encourage your network to inspire others. â• Follow me ( Stephanie Hills, Ph.D. ) for more like this. #freedomseekers #careerfreedom #leadershipdevelopment # leadershipdevelopment #worklifebalance #careeralignment #careerIlove

name: stephaniehillsphd
headline: Back in college, I waited tables to make ends meet. I was fast, sharp, and proud of how I handled things under pressure.
content: Back in college, I waited tables to make ends meet. I was fast, sharp, and proud of how I handled things under pressure. But one day, I noticed the other waitresses whispering. I finally asked, â€œWhatâ€™s up? Why are yâ€™all always talking about me?â€ One of them looked me straight in the eye and said: â€œYouâ€™re really smart. But every time something goes wrong, you make excuses instead of owning it.â€ ğŸ˜± That hit me hard. They were right. I thought being smart meant I always had an answer. But smart isnâ€™t the same as being a problem solver . ğŸ‘‰ Ever been in that position? ğŸ‘‰ When things go wrong, do you explainâ€¦ or do you take action? ğŸ‘‰ Do you try to protect your ego, or do you focus on fixing the problem? The truth isâ€” your value isnâ€™t always in what you know. Itâ€™s in how you solve problems. From that day forward, I changed how I showed upâ€”at work, in life, in leadership. I became solution-focused, and it completely shifted my growth trajectory. ğŸ”¥ 10 Steps to Become a World-Class Problem Solver ğŸ”¥ 1ï¸âƒ£ Own the problem. Donâ€™t blame. Donâ€™t deflect. Take responsibility, even if itâ€™s not entirely yours. Be the "top cover" for your team to own the problem with the "buck stops here" attitude. 2ï¸âƒ£ Stay calm in the crisis. Emotion clouds judgment. Leaders breathe, then lead. Your emotional temperature sets the environment for the rest of the team. 3ï¸âƒ£ Listen and Learn. Talk to the people closest to the problemâ€”your team, your customers, your peers. Listen deeply to better understand the issue and collaborate for the best solutions. When problems together, the team owns the solution. 4ï¸âƒ£ Define the root cause. Most people solve the symptom, not the root. Ask â€œWhy?â€ five times. Also ask, what can we do to prevent this from happening again or how can we make it better? 5ï¸âƒ£ Break it down. Large problems become manageable when you split them into steps. 6ï¸âƒ£ Get curious, not critical. Replace judgment with questions. â€œWhat can we learn?â€ opens doors. 7ï¸âƒ£ Use constraints to create clarity. Limited time or resources can lead to the most innovative ideas. 8ï¸âƒ£ Communicate clearly. Great problem solvers explain the issue and the solution simply. As Einstein said "If you can't explain it simply, you don't understand it well enough." 9ï¸âƒ£ Take fast action. Donâ€™t wait for perfect. Move forward with a clear direction and adjust as you go. ğŸ”Ÿ Reflect and Pivot. What worked? What didnâ€™t? Build a playbook for next time. âš¡ï¸ Smart people know the answers. Problem solvers create the outcomes. âš¡ï¸ â‰ï¸ What is your tip to be a "world-class" problem solver? â™» Repost to encourage your network to inspire others. â• Follow me ( Stephanie Hills, Ph.D. ) for more like this. #freedomseekers #careerfreedom #leadershipdevelopment # leadershipdevelopment #cultureofinnovation

headline: While the sun was rising this morning at 6.30am, our frontline officers were already up and ready to serve.
content: While the sun was rising this morning at 6.30am, our frontline officers were already up and ready to serve. At the Certis East Coast Deployment Centre, the early morning buzz was a familiar sight - purposeful, focused, and full of quiet determination. On the eve of Lunar New Year, it felt especially meaningful to drop by to distribute oranges, extend my festive greetings to our officers and to thank them for their service. Many of them will be on duty throughout the public holidays, steadfast and vigilant as always. Honoured to wish them well as they head out to perform their duties, keeping Singapore safer, smarter, and better for all. Zunjie Chong Jackie Ong Raymond Poh Sing Ling Chua (IHRP-SP) Julian Chee

name: davidlowjw
headline: Itâ€™s been a fun but honestly pretty hectic past two weeks.
content: Itâ€™s been a fun but honestly pretty hectic past two weeks. I just wrapped up the AI Telco RCA challenge[1], travelled to Bali for my nephewâ€™s wedding, and unexpectedly found myself reliving memories of my own Bali wedding 14 years ago. Somewhere in between all that, I was also honoured to be named one of the "Top AI Leaders to Watch". Thank you #Traicon and #AIRevolutionSummit for the recognition. Still feels a bit surreal. All this somehow made me reflect on my own â€œvibe codingâ€ journey. It started early last year when I saw Andrej talking about vibe coding on X. Out of curiosity, I jumped in. First starting with a ChatGPT, then GitHub Copilot, and eventually Cursor AI IDE. I was actually quite an early Cursor user. To the Cursor folks who reached out for feedbackâ€¦ sorry, I never got back to you. Work has been intense, and Iâ€™ve mostly been using it for side projects. Those side projects turned out to be pretty fun though. I built crypto trading algos (intra-minute and swing trading), a web app that generates 3D models for my wifeâ€™s 3D printing business, and eventually used vibe coding to join the Zindi challenge to build a telco RCA LLM. Naturally, the conversation has shifted from if AI Agents can replace coders to when that might actually happen. Sam Altman has even suggested that we may soon see a one-person startup reaching unicorn status powered entirely by AI agents without hiring a single human. As an AI/ML practitioner, that sparked my curiosity to explore whether AI agents could perform my work autonomously. I decided to use the Zindi challenge as a litmus test. Short answer is No. Not yet. But hereâ€™s the teaser. It did help us get into the top 10 on the leaderboard in one of the track. Iâ€™ll share more in a follow up post on how I vibe coded my way there, where LLMs really shine, and where the real bottlenecks still are. At this point, I donâ€™t even think of it as â€œcoding with vibesâ€ anymore. It feels more like working with a trusted, experienced software engineer who can brainstorm with you and execute exactly what you have in mind. [1] The AI Telco Troubleshooting Challenge - https://lnkd.in/gyTA2Gce

name: matthewsharp
headline: The build vs buy dichotomy isn't new.
content: The build vs buy dichotomy isn't new. AI is shifting the dichotomy toward build, but there are still plenty of reasons to buy. That said. If you are going to go with a vendor, at least use it's unique features. I've seen this a lot, a team goes through a procurement process, chooses a tool based on it's capabilities and pats themselves on the back. In the meantime, the engineers in charge of delivering the tool will avoid using some of the vendor specific features. There's lots of good reasons for it. Wanting to avoid lock in, make it easier to switch to a different vendor later, etc. This gives them the greatest flexibility to opt out easier later, but from a business perspective, why?!? I've seen this a lot when it comes to databases. A company goes all in on Redshift, BigQuery, Vertica, ClickHouse or some other tool, only to strip it of all it's features and run it like it's Postgres. Why are you paying extra and not taking advantage?!? It's like going to an all expense resort or cruise and eating sack lunches from home instead of at the provided buffet. If you want to avoid going through a door you can't back track out of, there are still ways to avoid the vendor lock in, but don't be paying for features you aren't using. Just hemorrhaging money.

name: laurennicoleryan
headline: Campaigns in HubSpot vs Salesforce has been a 'hot topic' for many many years.
content: Campaigns in HubSpot vs Salesforce has been a 'hot topic' for many many years. They're not the same. They function differently. .... but A product update landed in my inbox this morning that may have changed that narrative a bit. First - no they're still not the same and no they still don't sync in the native integration (you create custom objects for Salesforce Campaigns in HubSpot & map them - so you can sync that data BUT it's still not a 1:1 campaign sync between HubSpot & Salesforce ğŸ˜‰) BUT HubSpot users migrating from Salesforce have long wondered when they can add contacts to a campaign manually or via automation & see a list of campaigns they're a part of. It looks like a Public Beta is now doing just that! With this beta you can: 1. Bulk associate a contact to a campaign 2. Manually associate from a record page 3. Manually associate from the campaigns tool 4. View contact campaign interactions 5. Add contacts to campaigns via a workflow action ğŸ¤¯ ğŸ‘‰ My takeaway here is that HubSpot is revisiting the fundamentals to further stake their claim as a true data-first, AI-powered customer platform. And that means revisiting the functionality that made it the leading marketing platform to ensure all aspects of GTM (even offline) are fully accounted for. This beta is available to Marketing Pro+ customers. Full deets here > https://lnkd.in/ee66D5Gc #HubSpotTipsandTricks #HubSpot #HubSpotProductUpdate

name: avr27
headline: In my previous post, I shared a higher level understanding of NMT(Neural Machine Translation) architecture. So, continuing from there: With the same context of language translation, let's see how different aspects of it work together.
content: In my previous post , I shared a higher level understanding of NMT(Neural Machine Translation) architecture. So, continuing from there: With the same context of language translation, let's see how different aspects of it work together. On a higher level, we have 4 major components: Embedding Layer - vector(numerical) representation of text data Encoder - that which understands the source language and condenses the patterns learned into what we call context/thought vector. Context Vector - the summarized representation of source language produced by the encoder Decoder - which is responsible for decoding the context vector into the desired translation. Let's connect the dots b/w the embedding layer, the encoder, the context vector, and the decoder: We use two-word embedding layers, one for the source language and the other for the target, to better represent the semantics b/w the words of the respective languages. The encoder is responsible for generating a thought vector or a context vector representing what the source language means. The encoder is an RNN cell. At time step t_0, the encoder is initialized with a zero vector by default. After finally getting trained on the sequence of source sentences/words, It produces a context vector, which is it's final external hidden state. The context vector's idea is to concisely represent a source language sentence. Also, in contrast to how the encoderâ€™s state is initialized (i.e., it is initialized with zeros), the context vector becomes the initial state for the decoder. This links the encoder and the decoder, making the whole model end-to-end differentiable. The decoder is responsible for decoding the context vector into the desired translation. Our decoder is an RNN as well. The context vector is the only piece of information that is available to the decoder about the source sentence. Thus, it is a crucial link b/w encoder and decoder. After getting initialized with the context vector as its initial state, the decoder then learns the patterns in the target text. Though it is possible for the encoder and decoder to share the same set of weights, it is usually better to use two different networks for the encoder and the decoder. This increases the number of parameters in our model, allowing us to learn the translations more effectively. For the prediction, we use something like the softmax function to predict the words. The full NMT system, with the details of how the GRU cell in the encoder connects to the GRU cell in the decoder and how the softmax layer is used to output predictions, is shown: We can also add Attention Mechanism to our decoder, which I briefly discussed in my previous post . In brief, adding attention to the decoder implies that it allows the decoder access to the encoder's state in order to learn more about the source sentence. In my next post, I'll discuss in more detail about "Attention Mechanism" and why the context vector is not sufficient to produce good quality translations. BTW, if you are interested in learning more about this, here is my very in-depth notebook on this topic, explaining the concepts and code implementation in great detail. ğŸ”—GitHub Link: Seq2Seq Learning - Implementing NMT System

name: ybernstein
headline: It's easy to be busy: it simply means that you're doing lots of stuff. Being productive, though, is about delivering value and is much harder: to be productive you have to make sure all the work you're doing is valuable, and minimise waste and unnecessary work.
content: It's easy to be busy: it simply means that you're doing lots of stuff. Being productive, though, is about delivering value and is much harder: to be productive you have to make sure all the work you're doing is valuable , and minimise waste and unnecessary work. To put it another way: busy people do many units of work; productive people focus on delivering large amounts of value per unit of work. So, how can you make sure you're being productive as a software engineer? Understand the context of your work. You cannot be productive if you don't know the reason for the work you're doing. You must go further than simply plucking tickets from a queue and doing what they say. Remember, you're not building software for the sake of it; you're building a product and a business. Know your product and you'll make better decisions while you're building it. Design your software. Software development is not primarily about coding; it's about designing software systems. Coding is the bit that happens once you have come up with a high-quality design. If you don't take the time to make plans and get input from your colleagues, you will make errors that introduce bugs and technical debt. Having discussions and writing documentation to capture your plans is not a waste of time. It's a key part of your job of a software engineer. It may not feel like it, but this will save you time in the long run. Question everything. Ask "why?" a lot. It's amazing what you'll learn, and the ways in which this will help you do things right the first time. Rigorous scrutiny and debate is a hallmark of a top engineering culture. Always be respectful, but never hesitate to subject things to scrutiny. Be lazy. The best way to do a piece of work efficiently is to avoid doing it at all! Is there an existing tool or feature that you can use? Can you reframe the problem so that a much less costly solution does the job? Is this whole thing even worth doing at all? Always ask the questions. Your time is a valuable resource, it is your responsibility to make sure it's being used efficiently.

name: tian-chong-ng-76739216
headline: 2024 Look Back LinkedIn Article Looking back at 2024, itâ€™s been an incredible year filled with many global events that captured attention. We saw the rise of ChatGPT, which continues to help many people discover their hidden potential, countries coming together to triple climate finance for developi
content: 2024 Look Back LinkedIn Article Looking back at 2024, itâ€™s been an incredible year filled with many global events that captured attention. We saw the rise of ChatGPT, which continues to help many people discover their hidden potential, countries coming together to triple climate finance for developing nations to better support their efforts, and on a fun note, the debut of breakdancing at the Summer Olympics that took the world by storm. For me, three themes stood out for business: digital transformation, evolving cyber threats and growing sustainably. Transforming the way we work, live and interact Singtel has come a long way since achieving nationwide 5G coverage in July 2022. Weâ€™ve been unlocking many new features such as network slicing so enterprises can exploit the technology to build new apps, operate more efficiently and enhance their customer engagement experiences. Itâ€™s exciting to see how network slicing and other 5G capabilities are being used across sectors like healthcare for surgical planning using augmented and mixed reality applications, advanced manufacturing to assemble cars or check for defects in products, and so much more. 3D visualisation of organs via mixed- and augmented-reality applications Thatâ€™s not all. By tapping on the huge volumes of data we process through our networks, weâ€™re able to develop Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) that can be used to tailor solutions that meet the unique needs of businesses. For instance, we can use APIs to build security apps that detect and mitigate threats in real time, enable seamless integration of payment systems, or even test and deploy multilingual communication platforms. This makes it easier for enterprises and developers to have the tools to create truly personalised and powerful digital experiences. And for greater impact, weâ€™ve been forging global alliances to explore APIs in a range of areas like security, 5G, and customer service. Weâ€™re developing a global first multilingual telco-specific large language model (LLM) with other leading telcos Deutsche Telekom, e&, and SK Telecom, as well as SoftBank that can be applied worldwide, democratising AI in the region. These advancements are not just transforming industries but impacting everyday lives. Tackling Cyber Threats Another game-changer is AI which has brought new opportunities for business innovation and growth as well as challenges like evolving scams and cybersecurity risks. This year, we rolled out many AI-enabled measures to enhance our scam prevention capabilities. One proud achievement is the development of SingVerify that leverages telco data to perform authentication in real time. Itâ€™s all done in the background and more importantly, provides an additional layer of defence from scams and fraud. But for this to be truly effective, we need to include all the local telcos and weâ€™re working on that. In tandem, weâ€™ve taken this initiative regional by deploying it in Malaysia and Thailand. Through our efforts, weâ€™re protecting over 57 million customers in these markets. By federating the telco APIs more telcos can protect their customers from digital fraud and scams. Here is us signing an MoU with M1 to extend the protection to their customers. As much as weâ€™re grappling with beating the ever-evolving cyber threat â€“ a new form is in the works thatâ€™ll be more powerful than any other threat weâ€™ve faced before. Quantum computing will soon become mainstream and will render current encryption and security measures ineffective. There is a pressing need to protect businesses here and our way of life. To get ahead of the threats, we launched Southeast Asiaâ€™s first quantum-safe network with industry leaders and have been progressively building a robust ecosystem of solutions that will help enterprises safeguard their digital assets. Itâ€™s all about staying one step ahead because the bad guys are also preparing, and we canâ€™t wait for them to show their hands and react â€“ weâ€™ll likely to be too late. Having the technology alone isnâ€™t enough. We need to prepare our workforce to have the skills necessary to thrive in an increasingly digital and automated world. Thatâ€™s why weâ€™ve been investing in equipping our employees in areas like AI, cybersecurity and 5G so they can harness the tech as transformative tools and not fear that their jobs will be taken over. All companies should be actively looking into this to ensure their staff and businesses are ready for whatâ€™s to come. Making Sustainability Real As we continue to pursue new innovations, we are mindful of our impact on our planet. For years, weâ€™ve taken steps to lower our carbon emissions throughout the supply chain â€“ from switching to electric vehicles, tapping solar energy for business operations, and cutting down on plastic packaging, to name a few. Our upcoming data centres are also going to use highly-efficient cooling technologies to cut water consumption. We will continue to explore the latest technology and industry best practices to reduce our carbon footprint as we work towards our net-zero 2045 goal. One of the exciting projects I was involved in this year, was the opening of Sistersâ€™ Islands Marine Park, which includes a lagoon tidal pool that has underwater cameras powered by #Singtel5G. With our connectivity, weâ€™re bringing a slice of Singaporeâ€™s incredible biodiversity into classrooms, to help students see the natural world in a whole new way and hopefully appreciate and learn to care more about our environment. The tidal pool will serve as a sanctuary for marine life and a living classroom for future generations to learn about and appreciate our thriving bio-diverse ecosystem. It's also been a year of milestones for Singtel Singapore. We scored a couple of big wins globally like with NestlÃ©, one of the worldâ€™s biggest food manufacturers. Weâ€™re helping to turn their global network into a cloud-centric one. On our shores, weâ€™re helping PSA to build a fully sustainable and autonomous port to meet rising global transshipment demand. These are proud moments for me when you can see the impact of what we do. At the Tuas Port, Automated Guided Vehicles (AGVs) will be upgraded to enhance real-time shipment tracking and further streamline crane operations. As we step into 2025, weâ€™ll be looking into how we can further harness emerging technologies like AI, quantum computing, and 6G to address the most pressing challenges of our time. Sustainability will remain a core focus as we explore innovative ways to reduce our carbon footprint while driving digital transformation. Technology for me has the power to bring us closer, to solve big problems, and to unlock new opportunities. And I know as a community we can achieve so much together. So letâ€™s keep pushing the boundaries for a better future. Hereâ€™s to an exciting 2025 for everyone!

name: shanehegde
headline: Our first Super Bowl ad!!!
content: Our first Super Bowl ad!!! An estimated 125 million people will watch the Super Bowl tonight... and where better to broadcast than in the most populous country in the world? Thatâ€™s right, Air 's first ever Super Bowl ad, starring Suniel Shetty and internet memetic sensation Darshan Magdun (yes, that Darshan) runs tonight right before the half time show. So tune into Star Sports India at 5am and get ready! Weâ€™re making history. In all seriousness, with Bad Bunny performing entirely in Spanish, we wanted to be part of the conversation happening around language, culture, and who â€œmainstreamâ€ creative work is for. This ad was designed to respond to that moment, not defensively, but confidently. Air was built to reinforce a simple truth: Great creative work travels. It doesnâ€™t belong to a single country, language, or accent. But it does have a home.

name: mahima-mehra-37aaa086
headline: Call to collaborate!
content: Call to collaborate! At HVT Foundation, we believe that true empowerment begins with awareness. Supporting rural children, youth, and women in building better hygiene practicesâ€”especially menstrual health awarenessâ€”is central to our mission. With the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) now making menstrual hygiene education mandatory in schools, the need for structured, sensitive, and informed workshops has never been greater. Under the HVT Education Program and our Community Awareness Initiatives, we are conducting menstrual hygiene and womenâ€™s healthcare workshops that cover: â€¢ Scientific understanding of menstruation â€¢ Breaking myths and taboos â€¢ Safe hygiene practices â€¢ Nutrition and self-care â€¢ Emotional well-being â€¢ Access to sustainable menstrual products Our goal is simple â€” to create informed communities where girls grow with confidence and dignity. We invite: â€¢ School Heads to connect with Vivek Kedia to introduce this workshop in your institution. â€¢ Community groups to connect with Anshu Saxena for grassroots workshops. â€¢ Sponsors and corporate partners to collaborate by sponsoring menstrual hygiene kits, sanitary products, awareness materials, and related essentials. â€¢ Partner organisations to join hands in expanding this mission. Volunteers can support through helping to conduct such awareness programs in schools and communities - connect with Nilay N. Parikh If you would like to support or collaborate, please write to: ğŸ“© Connect@hvtfoundation.org Together, letâ€™s build healthier, informed, and empowered rural communities. ğŸŒ¸ #menstrualhealth #hvtfoundation #OnGroundImpact #listeningtocommunities #menstrual #DevelopmentWithDignity #menstrualeducation

name: joseph-fuge
headline: WebMCP looks like a great step to making websites more AI agent friendly.
content: WebMCP looks like a great step to making websites more AI agent friendly. Hopefully this reduces both GenAI agent costs and website request hammering from agents as they accomplish their task with fewer requests to the web server by nature of getting it right the first time via the WebMCP tool. The Declarative API (described in the Google documentation linked below) to enable web developers to set up WebMCP for their site seems to be really simple, especially if the functionality you want to provide to the GenAI agent can already be performed by the user through an HTML form element. A couple simple HTML attributes on the form and that functionality is ready to go. Even the Imperative API, which you would put in a JS script tag, is straightforward as well. It is currently in early access only, but I'm curious to see how it will be adopted in the future. MCP authentication, prompt injection, and other security issues remain a concern. If your personal GenAI agent with sensitive information stumbles onto a malicious website with adversarial tools exposed via WebMCP, it could be a fast track to losing your personal data. Here are some resources to understand WebMCP better: - Brief overview video from Sentry 's Syntax YouTube channel: https://lnkd.in/gaxCt5iH Wes Bos makes a great point in the video - companies who want people, not agents, to use the site to facilitate their business model will not want to configure WebMCP tools to maintain ad revenues, opportunities to upsell, and more. - Google's early preview documentation: https://lnkd.in/gb42EnaY I'll be thinking about whether it makes sense for LocoLingua to enable WebMCP. Maybe companies will move towards managing their third party tools through natural language in the future as security concerns are resolved. Take care

name: tian-chong-ng-76739216
headline: Tomorrow marks an eventful first year for me at Singtel. I continue to be amazed by my immensely talented colleagues who live our purpose of empowering every generation in every product and service they deliver.
content: Tomorrow marks an eventful first year for me at Singtel. I continue to be amazed by my immensely talented colleagues who live our purpose of empowering every generation in every product and service they deliver. Iâ€™ve had a busy year restructuring the business to get us fitter. From setting up a new leadership team and integrating the consumer and enterprise streams to simplifying our product portfolio and improving customer experiences â€“ itâ€™s been a sea of change but am glad to have a great team to do this with. Some notable moments include: 1. Getting future-ready. Evolving cyberthreats, including mobile phone scams, are an area of concern with victims in Singapore having lost more than half a billion dollars in 2023. Added to this is the emergence of deepfake videos spreading disinformation which can lead to harm. As the telco with the largest customer base in Singapore, we take this very seriously because we know that our customers rely on our expertise to keep them safe. Last September, we introduced Cyber Elevate, a one-stop affordable cyber security resilience programme designed to equip #SMEs with the necessary capabilities and skillsets to prepare, detect, respond and recover from cyber-attacks. We also teamed up with the Singapore Institute of Management (SIM) Academy to develop â€œDefence Against Cyber Scams" â€“ a cyber scam preparedness programme aimed at #upskilling and #reskilling staff large enterprises, especially those handling frontline communications from financial institutions that are more commonly targeted by scammers. The programme kicked off with UOB - training over 1,000 of their frontline branch staff. These are meant to prepare small businesses and employees deal with increasingly sophisticated threats, many which involve social engineering. Weâ€™re also very proud that Singtel has been appointed by IMDA to develop Singaporeâ€™s first National Quantum-Safe Network Plus (#NQSN+) for enterprises, in partnership with global industry leaders, ID Quantique, Fortinet, Cisco and Nokia to secure Singapore against future threats. To many, the idea of getting scammed or cyber attacked is seen as a distance threat or something thatâ€™ll â€œnever happen to usâ€. â€œWeâ€™re just an SME, nobody will want to attack us,â€ is another common refrain. But the nature of the fast-evolving technology is that the measures of today will fast become obsolete. And to wait till things are dire to set things up is like trying to put out a forest fire when itâ€™s at your doorstop â€“ it might be too late. Not to sound too dramatic but seeing how quickly businesses, especially SMEs, can crumble when faced with such calamities, we cannot emphasise enough, the importance of being prepared. And we know it can seem overwhelming to the small businesses â€“ but there are numerous avenues to seek help, including government grants to offset costs. Inaction in this matter, could be fatal. 2. Going more social. The convergence of social connections and commerce is driving more personalised, social and interactive purchasing experiences for customers, and this will increase in the years to come. Thatâ€™s why we added a Tik Tok studio to our flagship store, 313@Somerset, so we can help content creators and entrepreneurs build their brands or sell their products using the popular social platform. We also added dedicated spaces within our store for our partner brands to engage and educate customers on their products and services; to this end, the first Casetify studio in Singapore that has done so well. For larger brands, providing that personal touch can be challenging amidst rising manpower shortages. Like many organisations, Singtelâ€™s been leveraging AI to automate more routine tasks such as making payments and replacing SIM cards, so that our customer service agents can be freed up to support customers in more meaningful and personal ways. But we want to be able to offer our customers more. Considering the high volume of data that telcos possess, we wanted to find a way to leverage this data to provide more value-added services to our customers. So we teamed up with leading telcos, SKT, TMobile and e&, with the support of Softbank, to develop Large Language Models (#LLM), optimised for the telecommunications industry. Covering languages such as Korean, English, German, Japanese and Bahasa, the LLMs are helping us to improve our customer interactions via digital assistants and chatbots. Soon, interactions across countries will no longer be limited by language barriers. Companies thatâ€™d like to scale beyond Singapore should factor in such advancements into their future plans. 3. Bridging divides and connecting communities. I had my first chance to participate in many of our ESG activities â€“ from planting trees to meeting many of our wonderful special needs students with all their hidden talents. It was a humbling experience for me to experience their tenacity and positive attitude. They truly teach us the value of empathy and how to harness our strengths. Our seniors are another resilient group teaching us how to be adaptable. Though many understand how to use the basics, there are many who are not as tech savvy and need help navigating their way through an increasingly digital world. Between the hustle and bustle of our day-to-day, letâ€™s find ways to support these vulnerable groups so they too can feel connected in a digital economy. Change can be good. Many technology innovations have emerged over the past year, rapidly shifting how we live, work and play. Artificial Intelligence (AI) in the form of Generative AI tools like #ChatGPT, quantum computing, #metaverse, #blockchain, augmented and virtual reality (#AR&VR), and other technology breakthroughs are shaping a new world. I am looking forward to an even more exciting year ahead and very proud to be working in a place thatâ€™s always striving to be at the leading edge of innovation to uplift communities and advance economies. #CyberSecurityInstitute #SingtelCSI #DigitalConnectivityBlueprint #SmartNation #Singtel5G #SingtelAI

content: ğ—œğ—»ğ—±ğ—¶ğ—® ğ˜„ğ—®ğ˜€ ğ—®ğ—¹ğ˜„ğ—®ğ˜†ğ˜€ ğ—²ğ—»ğ˜ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—½ğ—¿ğ—²ğ—»ğ—²ğ˜‚ğ—¿ğ—¶ğ—®ğ—¹ â€” ğ—·ğ˜‚ğ˜€ğ˜ ğ—»ğ—¼ğ˜ ğ—²ğ˜ƒğ—²ğ—»ğ—¹ğ˜†. ğ˜ğ˜¯ ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜­ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¦ 90ğ˜´, ğ˜¸ğ˜©ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ ğ˜¢ ğ˜µğ˜ºğ˜±ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜­ ğ˜«ğ˜¦ğ˜¸ğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜­ğ˜¦ğ˜³ ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜±ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜¶ğ˜¦ğ˜³ ğ˜§ğ˜³ğ˜°ğ˜® ğ˜”ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¸ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜ª ğ˜°ğ˜³ ğ˜‘ğ˜¢ğ˜ªğ˜¯ ğ˜¤ğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜®ğ˜¶ğ˜¯ğ˜ªğ˜µğ˜º ğ˜ªğ˜¯ ğ˜‰ğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜£ğ˜¢ğ˜º ğ˜¸ğ˜¢ğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜¥ ğ˜µğ˜° ğ˜¦ğ˜¹ğ˜±ğ˜¢ğ˜¯ğ˜¥ ğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜´ ğ˜£ğ˜¶ğ˜´ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜´; hğ˜¦ ğ˜¤ğ˜¢ğ˜­ğ˜­ğ˜¦ğ˜¥ ğ˜¢ ğ˜ºğ˜°ğ˜¶ğ˜¯ğ˜¨ ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜·ğ˜¦ ğ˜§ğ˜³ğ˜°ğ˜® ğ˜¢ ğ˜´ğ˜®ğ˜¢ğ˜­ğ˜­ ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜¸ğ˜¯. ğ˜ˆ 22-ğ˜ºğ˜¦ğ˜¢ğ˜³-ğ˜°ğ˜­ğ˜¥ ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜³ğ˜ªğ˜·ğ˜¦ğ˜¥ ğ˜ªğ˜¯ ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜¤ğ˜ªğ˜µğ˜º ğ˜¸ğ˜ªğ˜µğ˜© ğ˜¢ğ˜¯ ğ˜¢ğ˜¥ğ˜¥ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜´, ğ˜¢ ğ˜±ğ˜­ğ˜¢ğ˜¤ğ˜¦ ğ˜µğ˜° ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜¢ğ˜º, ğ˜¢ğ˜¯ğ˜¥ ğ˜¢ ğ˜±ğ˜³ğ˜°ğ˜®ğ˜ªğ˜´ğ˜¦ ğ˜°ğ˜§ ğ˜¸ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¬. ğ˜ğ˜¦ ğ˜­ğ˜¦ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¯ğ˜¦ğ˜¥ ğ˜£ğ˜º ğ˜¸ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¤ğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜¨ â€” ğ˜©ğ˜°ğ˜¸ ğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜°ğ˜¯ğ˜¦ğ˜´ ğ˜¸ğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜¦ ğ˜·ğ˜¢ğ˜­ğ˜¶ğ˜¦ğ˜¥, ğ˜©ğ˜°ğ˜¸ ğ˜±ğ˜³ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¦ğ˜´ ğ˜¸ğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜¦ ğ˜¯ğ˜¦ğ˜¨ğ˜°ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜¥, ğ˜©ğ˜°ğ˜¸ ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜­ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜°ğ˜¯ğ˜´ğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜±ğ˜´ ğ˜®ğ˜¢ğ˜µğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¥ ğ˜¢ğ˜´ ğ˜®ğ˜¶ğ˜¤ğ˜© ğ˜¢ğ˜´ ğ˜®ğ˜¢ğ˜³ğ˜¨ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜´. ğ˜‰ğ˜º ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜µğ˜ªğ˜®ğ˜¦ ğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜¸ğ˜¢ğ˜´ 30, ğ˜©ğ˜¦ ğ˜©ğ˜¢ğ˜¥ ğ˜´ğ˜¦ğ˜µ ğ˜¶ğ˜± ğ˜¢ ğ˜´ğ˜®ğ˜¢ğ˜­ğ˜­ ğ˜°ğ˜§ğ˜§ğ˜ªğ˜¤ğ˜¦ ğ˜°ğ˜§ ğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜´ ğ˜°ğ˜¸ğ˜¯. No one called this a startup. But it was entrepreneurship in its most durable form. Long before the word startup entered everyday vocabulary, India had a deep and functioning business culture. It lived inside trading communities, family enterprises, and apprenticeship-led industries like jewellery, diamonds, textiles, and manufacturing. Capital moved through relationships, skills were learned through proximity, and risk was absorbed by community. ğ˜Œğ˜¯ğ˜µğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜±ğ˜³ğ˜¦ğ˜¯ğ˜¦ğ˜¶ğ˜³ğ˜´ğ˜©ğ˜ªğ˜± ğ˜¦ğ˜¹ğ˜ªğ˜´ğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜¥, ğ˜£ğ˜¶ğ˜µ ğ˜ªğ˜µ ğ˜¸ğ˜¢ğ˜´ ğ˜ªğ˜¯ğ˜©ğ˜¦ğ˜³ğ˜ªğ˜µğ˜¦ğ˜¥ ğ˜®ğ˜°ğ˜³ğ˜¦ ğ˜µğ˜©ğ˜¢ğ˜¯ ğ˜ªğ˜µ ğ˜¸ğ˜¢ğ˜´ ğ˜¢ğ˜¤ğ˜¤ğ˜¦ğ˜´ğ˜´ğ˜ªğ˜£ğ˜­ğ˜¦. In the 90s and early 2000s, as India liberalised, attention shifted. Multinationals became aspirational, MBAs became credentials, and large organisations became the safest way to grow with status and structure. Business ownership didnâ€™t disappear, but it moved out of the spotlight. For an entire generation, success became less about building something of your own and more about being selected by institutions that promised growth with guardrails. What has changed in the last decade is not the instinct to build, but ACCESS. Startup culture has quietly democratised capital and legitimacy. Capital no longer flows only through family networks or traditional business communities; it increasingly flows through ideas, execution, and market opportunity. Just as importantly, legitimacy â€” the permission to try â€” is no longer tied to lineage, geography, or a specific set of industries. This is why startups feel culturally significant. ğ™ğ™ğ™šğ™® ğ™–ğ™§ğ™š ğ™£ğ™¤ğ™© ğ™˜ğ™§ğ™šğ™–ğ™©ğ™ğ™£ğ™œ ğ™šğ™£ğ™©ğ™§ğ™šğ™¥ğ™§ğ™šğ™£ğ™šğ™ªğ™§ğ™¨ ğ™¨ğ™¤ ğ™¢ğ™ªğ™˜ğ™ ğ™–ğ™¨ ğ™§ğ™šğ™¢ğ™¤ğ™«ğ™ğ™£ğ™œ ğ™©ğ™ğ™š ğ™ğ™£ğ™«ğ™ğ™¨ğ™ğ™—ğ™¡ğ™š ğ™¥ğ™§ğ™šğ™§ğ™šğ™¦ğ™ªğ™ğ™¨ğ™ğ™©ğ™šğ™¨ ğ™©ğ™ğ™–ğ™© ğ™¤ğ™£ğ™˜ğ™š ğ™™ğ™šğ™˜ğ™ğ™™ğ™šğ™™ ğ™¬ğ™ğ™¤ ğ™œğ™¤ğ™© ğ™©ğ™¤ ğ™—ğ™šğ™˜ğ™¤ğ™¢ğ™š ğ™¤ğ™£ğ™š. You no longer need inherited ecosystems to access early capital or ambition. In many ways, this moment is less about disruption and more about distribution â€” of confidence, of opportunity, and of belief. shuchi bansal thank you for this piece. Hindustan Times
